name: Clock Multiplier
description:
This algorithm is a simple clock multiplier, generating a faster clock from a slower one.

The output clock rate is updated on every clock received, except that the clock duration is limited to at most double each time. This is mainly to prevent the output clock rate changing when the input clock is paused and restarted, which would otherwise be interpreted as a really long clock pulse.

parameters.name: Output_mode
parameters.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above.

parameters.name: ES-5_Expander
parameters.description: If set, the ES-5 expander header to use for output instead of the bus specified by the Clock output parameter. "1" means the ES-5 itself.

parameters.name: ES-5_Output
parameters.description: If using an ES-5 expander output, sets which of the 8 outputs on the expander to use.

input_ports.name: Clock_input_port
input_ports.description: The clock input signal port, corresponding to the Clock input bus parameter.

output_ports.name: Clock_output_port
output_ports.description: The clock output signal port, corresponding to the Clock output bus parameter and ES-5 expander settings when applicable.

output_ports.name: Low_voltage_output_port
output_ports.description: Outputs the low voltage level when the clock is inactive (corresponding to Low voltage setting).

output_ports.name: High_voltage_output_port
output_ports.description: Outputs the high voltage level when the clock is active (corresponding to High voltage setting).
